One way is to dump the output into a textfile using "java -cp tests.jar;junit.jar com.foo.TestCase > textfile.txt".
This is probably the simplest way but is not good in any way. The best way I think is to use
ANT for this, in ant you can generate text-, html- and XML- files from the testcases. The html
pages are pretty good, they show if anything went bad and it is simple to find the testmethod that
failed.

Check out the JUNIT target at the ant.apache.org website. If you want I can send
you our complete ANT script to compile and run tests.

//Erik

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Srivastava, Pradeep 
  To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com' 
  Sent: Monday, September 22, 2003 7:36 AM
  Subject: [junit] How to capture junit test reports


  Hi all,


  I am new to junit, pls tell me how can I capture the output of junit tests
  and put them in a text file or an html file for all cases of success,
  failures or errors. I need to show this to the client claiming that our
  system is passing all the unit tests cases. I am using junit without ANT.

  pls send me some sample script if possible ..

  Thanks and Regards
  Pradeep
